meanings.definition: To order (an item) before it is available for purchase.
meanings.sent1: I will preorder the new video game to make sure I get it as soon as it comes out.
meanings.sent2: Customers often preorder popular books to ensure they receive a copy on the release date.
meanings.sent3: Sarah decided to preorder the concert tickets, so she wouldn't miss her favorite band performing.
meanings.sent4: By choosing to preorder the limited edition sneakers, he secured his pair before they sold out.
meanings.sent5: The fans rushed to preorder the concert tickets, eager to secure their spots in the front row.

meanings.definition: An order for an item before it is available for purchase.
meanings.sent1: She placed a preorder for the new smartphone model to be one of the first to own it.
meanings.sent2: The store received a large number of preorders for the upcoming toy release.
meanings.sent3: The preorder for the special edition vinyl record was so popular that it sold out within hours.
meanings.sent4: His preorder for the limited edition sneakers made him the envy of his friends.
meanings.sent5: The company announced that preorders for the new product exceeded all expectations.
